vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/4a576542-3bb8-41ba-bb5c-e428c92a58ef">WORKERS</keyword>         <topcClas>Population censuses - Population, vital statistics and censuses</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The aggregate statistics produced as outputs from UK censuses provide information on a wide range of demographic and socio-economic characteristics of the population of the United Kingdom. They are predominantly a collection of aggregated, or summary counts of the numbers of people, families or households resident in specific geographical areas or 'zones' possessing particular characteristics, or combinations of characteristics drawn from the themes of population, people and places, families, ethnicity and religion, health, work, and housing.<br> <br> Aggregate statistics are available for the full range of geographies employed within the census, from the smallest (output areas with an average of 150 persons in England and Wales), to national level. For further information about the geographies used in the output of census aggregate statistics, see the section on census geography in the Office for National Statistics' <a href="http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/guide-method/geography/beginner-s-guide/index.html" title="Beginner's Guide to UK Geography">Beginner's Guide to UK Geography</a>.<br> <br> Data can be accessed through <a href="http://infuse.mimas.ac.uk/" title="InFuse">InFuse</a> and <a href="http://casweb.mimas.ac.uk/" title="Casweb">Casweb</a> <br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The aggregate statistics outputs from the 2001 Census are available in three main datasets: <br> <ul><li>key statistics - summary tables covering the most significant and requested counts</li><li>standard tables - the most detailed of the aggregate statistics tables (not produced for the smallest geographical areas used in the census)</li><li>census area statistics - mostly versions of the Standard Tables for smaller areas, but containing less detail</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="single" date="2001-04-29T00:00:00Z">29 April 2001</timePrd>         <collDate event="single" date="2001-04-29T00:00:00Z">29 April 2001</collDate>         <nation>England and Wales</nation>         <nation>Northern Ireland</nation>         <nation>Scotland</nation>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <geogUnit>Output Areas</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit> Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>All people present in England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland on census day.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Alpha/numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>No sampling (total universe)</sampProc>         <collMode>Self-completion</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No weighting used</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Open</specPerm>         <restrctn>Data may be accessed via <a href="http://infuse.mimas.ac.uk" title="InFuse">InFuse</a> or <a href="http://casweb.mimas.ac.uk/" title="Casweb">Casweb</a>. This data is freely available to all and is licensed under the terms of the Open Government Licence.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>1488 1966 Census Small Area Statistics (Ward Library) </relStdy>       <relStdy>3182 1991 Census: Small Area Statistics by 1981 Census Wards; Great Britain </relStdy>       <relStdy>5039 1981 Census: Aggregate Data; Great Britain </relStdy>       <relStdy>5048 1991 Census: Aggregate Data; Northern Ireland </relStdy>       <relStdy>5563 1971 Census: Aggregate Data; Great Britain </relStdy>       <relStdy>5850 Deprivation Scores Based on 1991 and 2001 Census Area Statistics </relStdy>       <relStdy>7427 2011 Census: Aggregate Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>22001 1991 Census: Aggregate Data; Great Britain </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
